Directions
For the Strawberry Layer:
In a blender, blend strawberries, water, and granulated sugar (if using) until smooth, about 1 minute. Add more water if the mixture looks too thick. Season to taste with additional sugar as needed. Transfer to a bowl; set aside. Rinse blender jar clean.
Serious Eats / Maureen Celestine
For the Blackberry Layer:
In the now-clean blender, blend blackberries, water, and granulated sugar (if using) until smooth, about 1 minute. Add more water if the mixture looks too thick. Season to taste with additional sugar as needed. Transfer to a bowl; set aside. Rinse blender jar clean.
Serious Eats / Maureen Celestine
For the Kiwi Layer:
In the now-clean blender, blend kiwis, water, and granulated sugar (if using) until smooth, about 1 minute. Add more water if the mixture looks too thick. Season to taste with additional sugar as needed. Transfer to a bowl; set aside. Rinse blender jar clean.
Serious Eats / Maureen Celestine
To Assemble:
Carefully pour the strawberry purée into six 3-ounce popsicle molds, filling each a third of the way up the mold and being careful to keep the walls of the molds free from drips. Cover molds and transfer to the freezer until just beginning to freeze, about 15 to 20 minutes. (The layer may appear loose at this point, but you can top with the next layer.)
Serious Eats / Maureen Celestine
Remove molds from the freezer and carefully pour blackberry purée over the semi-frozen strawberry purée, filling each mold another third of the way up the mold and being careful to keep the walls of the molds free from drips. Cover molds and freeze until semi-frozen, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Serious Eats / Maureen Celestine
Again remove the molds from the freezer and carefully pour the kiwi purée over the semi-frozen blackberry purée, filling each mold to the marked fill line, and being careful to keep the walls of the molds free from drips. Cover molds and freeze until fully solid, about 4 hours. When ready to serve, gently unmold each popsicle.
Serious Eats / Maureen Celestine
Special Equipment
Blender, six 3-ounce popsicle molds and popsicle sticks
Notes
To use frozen strawberries, blend 3/4 cup (120g) frozen strawberries with 1/2 cup (120ml) water and season to taste with granulated sugar.
To use frozen blackberries, blend 3/4 cup (120g) frozen blackberries with 1/2 cup (120ml) water and season to taste with granulated sugar.
Make Ahead and Storage
Popsicles can be frozen for up to 3 months.
